result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor J. Chapleski Garrison

records.addlTxt:
3:08 pm - Defendant Trevor J. Chapleski Garrison appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr appeared by video for Trevor J. Chapleski Garrison.  Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. Offer extended 09-21-22.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Scheduling conference on November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Further proceedings on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Attorney Amanda Skorr is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $20.00 per month commencing 10-01-22.
